shortdesc.ph: Sets channel options and leaves the channel.
Sets channel options and leaves the channel.
Sets channel options and leaves the channel.
Sets channel options and leaves the channel.

p.codeblock: Future<void> leaveChannelEx( {required RtcConnection connection, LeaveChannelOptions? options});
public abstract int LeaveChannelEx(RtcConnection connection, LeaveChannelOptions options);

section.p: After calling this method, the SDK stops all audio and video interactions, leaves the current channel, and releases all session-related resources. After successfully joining a channel using , you must call this method to end the call, otherwise you cannot start a new one.

After calling this method, the SDK stops all audio and video interactions, leaves the current channel, and releases all session-related resources. You must call this method after successfully joining a channel using to end the call; otherwise, you cannot start a new call.

After this method is called, the SDK stops audio and video communication, leaves the current channel, and releases all session-related resources. After successfully joining a channel by calling , you must call this method to end the call; otherwise, you cannot start the next call.

After calling this method, the SDK stops audio and video interactions, leaves the current channel, and releases all session-related resources. After successfully joining a channel using , you must call this method or to end the call, otherwise you cannot start a new one.

ul.li: This method is asynchronous. When the call returns, it does not mean the user has actually left the channel.
If you call , it will leave both channels joined via and .

note.ph: If you call immediately after this method, the SDK will not trigger the callback.

ul.li: This method is asynchronous. When the call returns, the channel has not actually been left.
If you call , it leaves both and channels.

note.ph: If you call immediately after this method, the SDK will not trigger the callback.

ul.li: This method is asynchronous. When the call returns, it does not mean the channel has been actually left.
If you call , you will leave both the channels joined by and .

note.ph: If you call immediately after calling this method, the SDK will not trigger the callback.

ul.li: This method is asynchronous. The return does not mean you have actually left the channel.
If you call or , you will leave both the channels joined by or and .

note.ph: If you call immediately after this method, the SDK will not trigger the callback.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method applies to multi-channel scenarios.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called after .
This method must be called after .

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p:
After successfully calling this method to leave the channel, the following callbacks are triggered:
Local: .
Remote: When a host leaves the channel, is triggered on the remote client.

Remote: When a host leaves the channel, the remote side triggers .

plentry.pd: Options for leaving the channel. See . This parameter only supports setting the stopMicrophoneRecording member in . Other members are not effective.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and suggestions.
